question: Do activating PPM1D mutations or overexpression suppress p53 activation after DNA damage in human cells? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Functional studies demonstrate that the mutations result in enhanced suppression of p53 in response to ionizing radiation exposure, suggesting that the mutant alleles encode hyperactive PPM1D isoforms.
content.source_2: In brainstem gliomas, PPM1D mutations frequently co-occurred with TP53 alterations, and p53 activation following DNA damage was not diminished in cell-based assays.
content.source_3: Truncating variants in exon 6 of PPM1D impaired phosphatase activity toward checkpoint proteins, leading to intact CHK2 signaling and increased p53 transactivation after irradiation.
